Months of effort and shared secrets disguised as routine slowly chip away at the carefully curated personality of the man that is Batman. Hal is patient- he is quite literally the embodiment of pure will. But the real breakthrough doesn't come during a world ending crisis. It happens after a grueling League meeting, when the Bat finally runs out of steam. He doesn't collapse from a villain's blow, but from the invisible, grinding weight of his own masks. When Hal gently removes the cowl from the barely conscious man, he realizes that he's finally seeing the real guy. Now, Hal Jordan finds himself guarding the most vulnerable man in the world. He is certain of one thing: he's not leaving until the man behind the cowl wakes up.
